file_content.text: We've come this far. We can't lose Corellia now.
Officer Dakron's been coordinating our efforts in the Black Hole. He's the man to see if you're going to help.
"Breaking news from the Core: Despite a stunning victory over the Empire, Republic forces continue to face violence and unrest on Corellia."
"Of particular concern to Republic authorities is the 'Black Hole' region, where most of the planet's hypermatter processing facilities and warehouses are located."
"Though most of the Black Hole is occupied by criminals and mercenaries, Imperial forces remaining on the planet are also attempting to claim its resources."
"Sources say the Black Hole is critical to the Republic war effort. Without sufficient quantities of hypermatter fuel, the fleet could be grounded within weeks."
They always said losing Corellia would lose us the war. Didn't really believe it until now.
I fought my way across Axial Park and into the Legislature. I was there when we declared Corellia was free!
But we won Corellia!
So I've heard. The Supreme Chancellor thought you might be sympathetic to our little problem.
I wasn't part of the fight, but this news report makes it sound like Corellia was already won.
Isn't Corellia ours?
Our forces broke the Imperial occupation. But no one's giving this planet up easy.
There are plenty of planets in the Republic. We'll just have to find hypermatter fuel somewhere else.
I'm not worried.
A lot of men died to win Corellia the first time. If we lose the Black Hole, then they died for nothing.
Are you always this friendly to total strangers? Or am I just special?
Do I know you?
Sorry to intrude, but the news report interested me. I'm hoping it interests you, too.
"Officials believe the unrest in the Black Hole is being encouraged by Harmon Torvix, a former member of the Corellian Council and a known Imperial sympathizer."
"Though the Empire has denounced Torvix, he maintains control of the area with the help of the Coronas, a powerful crime syndicate based in Coronet City."
Powerful? The Coronas are vicious. Their leader, Kovic, is known as the "Shadow of Corellia." Likes to make CorSec officers disappear from broad daylight.
He knows Corellia as well as any CorSec officer and twice as well as our men. If the Republic wants to take the Black Hole, they'll need to take him down first.
You must watch an awful lot of these news reports.
You're well informed.
I like to stay up-to-date. You never know what's going to come in handy later.
Seems like the Republic or CorSec could use this information.
Why tell me this?
You never know. You might find yourself in the Black Hole one of these days.
I'm not afraid of a shadow. The Republic shouldn't be either.
Kovic's just a thug.
They might not be, if they had someone so confident around.
"The Supreme Chancellor is aware of the crisis on Corellia. After a consultation with her advisors, she sent the following message to Republic forces in the field."
"The fight ahead will be difficult. But you've already won Corellia. As long as we stand with our allies, no one can take it from us again."
Too bad pretty words don't fuel starships. The Republic can't lose the Black Hole, to Councillor Torvix or the Empire.
Agent Carhart, SIS. The Supreme Chancellor asked me to make sure you were aware of the situation. She's hoping you'll volunteer to help.
I'll do whatever it takes to help the Republic win.
Sign me up.
If the Republic is in need, the Jedi will answer.
For her, always.
I volunteered for this back on Ord Mantell. Just tell me where to go.
It's my job to help.
Why not? The Chancellor usually makes it worth my while.
Sounds profitable.
I'm not taking on the whole Empire and Torvix's goons by myself, am I?
Help do what, exactly?
Hopefully it won't come to that. But you'll have to get to Corellia fast.
The Black Hole's located in Labor Valley. Once you get in, talk to CorSec officer Sal Dakron. He'll put you to work wherever you're needed most.
I'll let the Supreme Chancellor know where you're headed. I'm sure she'll appreciate it. Good luck down there.
Too busy. [Refuse quest]
Welcome to Carrick Station, friend. Heard any interesting news lately?
